page.title: 01Introduction to Worlingworth
page.content: Worlingworth is an agricultural village It is typical of the area & has two groups of Council houses(with a third being built)& private ribbon develop- ment along the roads.Most of the area is farmland producing;beet,rape,cereals pigs etc.The major employer is an agric -ultural engineering firm.Most people use private cars.A community bus is available & the nearest railway station is at Diss.The Community Council admin- isters the playingfield & pavilion which are near the village pub.Other amenities include a shop & post office, a telephone kiosk & an Anglican church. The village hall is a wooden structure near to the primary school which has two staff & 34 pupils aged between rising five & eleven years.
